result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas H. Johnston IV was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Homicide by Veh. Use-Control. Substance, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.09(1)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
*  Restitution to be determined; hearing to be set before Commissioner Dowse.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

records.addlTxt: District Attorney Robert Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney J Caviale.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Victim's family present.  Statements by:  Scott W., Michelle W.  Court imposes a total sentence of 15 years WSP; 5 years initial confinement w/credit for 2 days served; 10 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is eligible for CIP/SAP; deft taken into custody from court; deft to submit DNA sample and pay $250 DNA surcharge; costs imposed, 5 year revocation of DL; IID; OWI assessment; restitution hearing to be set before Commissioner Dowse.  Bond held pending determination of restitution.

District Attorney Robert Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney J Caviale.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Miranda Goodchild hearing.  Atty Caviale's motion to suppress.  Court finds that there is a stipulation that the deft made his statement to Deputy Fonk on the date of the offense freely and voluntarily.  Witnesses are sequestered.  Testimony taken from:  KSD Detective Ken Krenz.  Court finds that the deft's statement is admissable; denies motion to suppress for reasons set forth on the record.  Case remains set for trial.  Bond continued.
WCS report;  Defendant has successfully completed Chapter 85.53 requirements.

District Attorney Robert Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney J Caviale.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Family of victim present.  DA Zapf states he was informed that counsel would not be prepared for the Miranda Goodchild hearing today, believes counsel also has an issue w/trial date. Court adjourns JS from 5/18/15 at 9am to 9/21/15 at 8:30am, pick & go; miranda goodchild hearing reset for 5/22/15 at 10am; deadline to designate expert and report by 7/1/15.  Bond continued.

Other conditions remain the same - Not to possess or consume alcohol. Not to posses or consume controlled substances without a prescription. No contact with the family of Nathaniel W. or their residences.

District Attorney Robert Zapf appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court without counsel. Clerk LE. Case was scheduled for preliminary hearing this morning. Def. is not eligible for SPD. Def. has turned in advocate counsel paperwork. Court appoints Atty. Douglas Henderson as advocate counsel. Time limits tolled for cause. Attorney status on 9-3-14 @ 1:00pm. Atty. Zapf requests bond conditions be amended to order WCS. Court orders WCS. Amended cash bond signed in court. Bond continued.
Defendant is not eligible for public defender representation.
